channel.title: Blizzard RWT vs Runescape RWT (Why RS messed up)
channel.description:
[b]Blizzard's ToS[/b]
[url=http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/info/basics/antigold.html]http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/info/basics/antigold.html[/url]
I am posting this link because it relates to Runescape's RWT.
If you read the topic it says basically to watch out for RWTing, and how selling gold/items/characters is against their ToS.
Now I checked their ToS([url=http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/legal/termsofuse.html]http://www.worldofwarcraft.com/legal/termsofuse.html[/url]), it states(on rule 11), that if a user sells anything from their game, they are not responsible for it what so ever. They do not recognize these types of transfer at all, and everything in the game is considered their property. And you ALSO are agreeing you have no entitlement to anything and everything in the game.
[b]Runescape's ToS.[/b] [url=http://www.runescape.com/terms/terms.ws]http://www.runescape.com/terms/terms.ws[/url]
Now under "our rights" [b]If you are possibly RWTing[/b]: Jagex has access to your account, and everything involving your account such as items, stats, ect. Meaning at any point in time they feel like you are breaking a RWT rule, or when they feel like it, they have the right to reset stats, and take your money [b]AND TAKE YOUR MEMBERSHIP AWAY.[/b]
Under their ToS, it says they have the right to change their ToS at any time, without notifying anyone, and it is basically your right to keep up with the changing of it.
That would be the only thing said about RWTing (I could find in ToS).
[b]LETS COMPARE[/b]
Now comparing Blizzard's ToS, and Runescape ToS.
We all know why Blizzard still has aloud this to happen. Basically if the "credit card companies" TRY and sue Blizzard, they will whip out their ToS saying, that the owner has no right to sell their property, and they were not aware the player was doing this, so therefore the right of a "charge back of money (from the CC company)" is therefore invalid.
What Runescape did, changed the game forever. They took out every possible way to transfer money. And at that time they needed to act fast, because Credit Card companies were charging back money Jagex could not supply them with. So instead of just changing the ToS, saying that its their property, ect ect (like Blizzard), they decided to just destroy what makes their game. If only they changed their ToS, maybe they could bring back what the game once was.
People CAN still RWT, as just look at the sites that are still up.
Also from what I don't understand, the quite known site "Rsbot.org" was taken down for having the copyrighted name of "RS" meaning "Runescape" Why can jagex not just use the same copyright law with the other gold trading sites?
Discuss, post if I posted any errors.

item.title: Blizzard RWT vs Runescape RWT (Why RS messed up)
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:15, topic:357162”][quote author=the elve age link=topic=453682.msg3325976#msg3325976 date=1283109519]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=453682.msg3324987#msg3324987 date=1283025932]

Well that makes sense, but JaGex needs to grow up. People make money off other peoples ideas all the time… I don’t see the inventor of the car complaining about taxis or buses…

But when they have it under a copyrighted law, thats why they get mad.
[/quote]They didn’t copyright scar bots, or home-made programs (ones that aren’t edited versions of the client) or the ways that people sell the stuff, so they have no copyrights over it.

Then why could they have sued them. They had to have had some copy right laws over them.

Using their cache illegally. Is against the law.
[/quote]Who are you talking about that got sued? Rsbot? Like I said, Jagex can only sue if it’s an edited version of their client, like RsBot is. Scar scripts were getting people banned, even though it’s none of Jagex’s property.

And the only reason Jagex won the RsBot suit was because the letters ‘Rs’ were in the URL.[/quote]

We’re now talking about 2 different things. Jagex gets mad when asians use their game to make real life money. Drop the convo lol

Read full topic

But when they have it under a copyrighted law, thats why they get mad.
[/quote]They didn’t copyright scar bots, or home-made programs (ones that aren’t edited versions of the client) or the ways that people sell the stuff, so they have no copyrights over it.

Then why could they have sued them. They had to have had some copy right laws over them.

Using their cache illegally. Is against the law.[/quote]Who are you talking about that got sued? Rsbot? Like I said, Jagex can only sue if it’s an edited version of their client, like RsBot is. Scar scripts were getting people banned, even though it’s none of Jagex’s property.

And the only reason Jagex won the RsBot suit was because the letters ‘Rs’ were in the URL.

item.description:
@primadude wrote:

~*icestorm*~:

I 100% agree with you elve, But you said they took out every way to transfer money. Isn’t there still alot of sites like gold4rs that still transfer? Or do they just farm it?

They can only do that by taking ownership of the account and farming the money, then once the money is gained the account is given back.

Personally, I would never do that.

Read full topic
